sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"群，帮，伙"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: group, crowd, gang, band, mob, throng, masses, swarm
means: group ： 普通用词，通常指有组织、有秩序的一群人，也可指无意汇集在一起的一群人。
crowd ： 常指无组织地乱哄哄地挤在一起的人群。
gang ： 常指从事非法、暴力或敌对活动的帮派或团伙。有时呈中性，词义同group。
band ： 多指一群有明确宗旨，为共同目的而结合在一起的人，常含贬义。
mob ： 指无组织、乱七八糟凑合在一起的乌合之众，或指聚集在一起寻衅滋事的人群，多为暴徒。
throug ： 书面用词，意义接近crowd，侧重密集地挤在一起的一群，含挤在一起向前推进之意。
masses ： 指群众或人民大众。
swarm ： 指人数众多，杂乱无章，不停移动的一群人。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"人们，人群"之意。
means: people ： 最普通用词，不带任何色彩，泛指不确定数量的人们。
masses ： 指群众或平民，在西方国家含贬义，在我国含褒义。
crowd ： 本义指一大群紧紧聚集在一起的人群，现指群众整体，由个体结合的人群或大众。
through与crowd含义很接近，常可换用，但侧重指向前运动的群众。
mob ： 含贬义，指乌合之众、暴民。

sentence.Network_en: He never understood how to organize or compress large masses of material.
sentence.Network_cn: 他从来就不懂如何对大篇的材料进行整理或精简。

sentence.Network_en: This issue has aroused much resentment among the masses.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个问题在民众中间引起了强烈的不满。

entry.def: A mass of things is a large number of them grouped together.

example.ex: On his desk is a mass of books and papers.
example.tran: 他的书桌上有大堆的书籍和文件。

entry.def: A mass  of something is a large amount of it.

example.ex: She had a mass of auburn hair.
example.tran: 她有一头浓密的棕发。

entry.def: Masses of something means a great deal of it.

example.ex: There's masses of work for her to do...
example.tran: 她有一大堆的工作要做。

example.ex: It has masses of flowers each year.
example.tran: 它每年都开许多花。

entry.def: Mass is used to describe something which involves or affects a very large number of people.

example.ex: ...ideas on combating mass unemployment...
example.tran: 对付大量失业的点子

example.ex: All the lights went off, and mass hysteria broke out.
example.tran: 所有的灯都熄灭了，大家都变得歇斯底里起来。

entry.def: A mass of a solid substance, a liquid, or a gas is an amount of it, especially a large amount which has no definite shape.

example.ex: ...before it cools and sets into a solid mass...
example.tran: 在它冷却成为固态之前

example.ex: The fourteenth century cathedral was reduced to a mass of rubble.
example.tran: 这座14世纪的大教堂变成了一堆瓦砾。

entry.tran: （与领导或受过高等教育的人相对的）普通老百姓，民众，平民大众
entry.def: If you talk about the masses, you mean the ordinary people in society, in contrast to the leaders or the highly educated people.

example.ex: His music is commercial. It is aimed at the masses...
example.tran: 他的音乐走商业化路线，针对的是一般大众。

example.ex: This issue has aroused much resentment among the masses.
example.tran: 这个问题在民众中间引起了强烈的不满。

entry.def: The mass of people are most of the people in a country, society, or group.

example.ex: The 1939-45 world war involved the mass of the population...
example.tran: 1939至1945年间的世界大战使大多数民众卷入其中。

example.ex: Schools allowed the mass of children to leave school at 16 with poor qualifications.
example.tran: 学校允许大部分考试成绩差的学生16岁时毕业离校。

entry.def: A mass of people is a large crowd of them.

example.ex: ...masses of excited people clogged the streets.
example.tran: 情绪激动的人群挤满了街道。

example.ex: ...a mass of grinning teenage faces.
example.tran: 一张张少年的笑脸

entry.def: When people or things mass, or when you mass them, they gather together into a large crowd or group.

example.ex: Shortly after the workers went on strike, police began to mass at the shipyard...
example.tran: 工人们罢工后不久，警察就开始在船厂集结。

example.ex: The clouds massed, whipped up by the wind...
example.tran: 云卷云舒随风起。

entry.def: If you say that something is a mass of things, you mean that it is covered with them or full of them.

example.ex: His body was a mass of sores...
example.tran: 他遍体鳞伤。

example.ex: In the spring, the meadow is a mass of daffodils.
example.tran: 春天，草地上开满了黄水仙。

entry.def: In physics, the mass of an object is the amount of physical matter that it has.

example.ex: Astronomers know that Pluto and Triton have nearly the same size, mass, and density.
example.tran: 天文学家知道冥王星与海卫一拥有几乎相同的体积、质量与密度。

entry.tran: 弥撒(尤指天主教或东正教的圣餐仪式，以此纪念耶稣基督的最后的晚餐)
entry.def: Mass is a Christian church ceremony, especially in a Roman Catholic or Orthodox church, during which people eat bread and drink wine in order to remember the last meal of Jesus Christ.

example.ex: She attended a convent school and went to Mass each day.
example.tran: 她上的是教会学校，每天都去做弥撒。

entry.def: A Mass is a piece of music which uses the prayers from the Christian ceremony of Mass as the words that are sung.
